by Engel (1920) .
L. r. reichenbachii
is not mentioned by the American Ornithologists’ Union (1998),
Remsen et al . (2008)
and the Comitê Brasileiro de Registros Ornitológicos (2007) .

= “larvae of an unidentified (probably Muscoidea) botfly”: Arendt 1985a [following Winterstein & Raitt 1983 ] MEXICO ( Arendt 1985a , following Winterstein & Raitt 1983 ); ( Young 1993 , following Winterstein & Raitt 1983 ); 7- 12 larvae per nestling of 3 infested nestlings, one nestling die ( Dudaniec & Kleindorfer 2006 , following Winterstein & Raitt 1983 ).
Note: this bird inhabits the Tropical Deciduous Forest ( 0-700 m ; Tropical and lower Subtropical zones) (American Ornithologists’ Union 1988).

Caracara plancus
[
brasiliensis (Gmelin, 1788)
]

Reduviidae
: Triatominae

BRAZIL : Distrito Federal : 4.7 ± 3.8 insects per palm of
Mauritia flexuosa
with nests of this species (Gurgel- Gonçalves et al . 2004); (
Ribeiro Júnior et al . 2006
: p. 327, tabela 1, only as
Polyborus plancus
for
R. prolixus
).

Note:
Ribeiro Júnior et al . (2006
: p. 327, tabela 1) include
P. plancus
below
R. prolixus
but Gurgel-Gonçalves et al . (2004), that consider
R. neglectus
, is cited among the references.

COLOMBIA : El Porvenir-Carimagua [exact place not specified], 2 eggs , 4 n II, 2 n IV, 2 n V and 4 males in 1 of 1 examined nest on the palm
Mauritia flexuosa (
D’Alessandro et al . 1984
)
; ( Carcavallo & Tonn 1985 ); (
Carcavallo et al . 1998b
); (
Ribeiro Júnior et al . 2006
: p. 327, tabela 1).

Note: Gamboa C. (1963) is cited among the references by Carcavallo & Tonn (1985) and
Carcavallo et al . (1998b)
but
Polyborus plancus
is only mentioned by Gamboa C. (1970).

SIPHONAPTERA
:
Ceratophyllidae

, fig. 5, 441).

, 1998b .

.

=

Corrêa et al . 1963
[following Freiras et al. 1960, correct bird identification]; Lucena & Lucena 1965 ; Barretto & Carvalheiro 1967 .

:

.

.

.

.

Note: evidently the record of
Ribeiro Júnior et al . (2006)
was taken from
Carcavallo et al . (1998a
, 1998b ), repeating the same error in the name of the bird.
= “blátidas”: Barretto & Carvalheiro 1967 .
= “baratas do mato”: Sick 1981 , 2001 .
